instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> are both 2.8V
threads.message:
Board had some little corrosion around Y1905 and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> rest of the board is clean.

PPBUS is 8.6V
3v42 is 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is 5V

But <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> are both 2.8V already replaced <CHIP>U8020</CHIP> and same thing.

Please advice!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> are both 2.8V
threads.message:
Get correct <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> first.

Inspect for corrosion near <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>; especially <RESISTOR>R7560</RESISTOR>/1/3.
You can play with <RESISTOR>R7560</RESISTOR>/1 to adjust <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> are both 2.8V
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> was replaced and same thing, <RESISTOR>R7560</RESISTOR>/1/3 no corrosion and measured ok.

Replaced <RESISTOR>R7561</RESISTOR> with 8.1K and walla!

Muchas gracias!
